item.title: CS/AI PhD Jobs Update 2025-11-24
item.description:
Assistant professor in Integrated semiconductor device and chip technologies (KTH)

  • Link: https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/847755?l=en
  • Responsibilities: Teach at both undergraduate and graduate levels; Carry out independent research; Manage administrative duties; Contribute actively to the operations and development of the cleanroom infrastructure at KTH’s Electrum Laboratory; Develop methods and optimize process flows for semiconductor devices and integrated circuits; Collaborate with academic and industrial actors and laboratory operational staff
  • Requirements: Completed a doctorate or equivalent scientific competence; Candidates who completed qualifications within the last seven years are prioritized; Consideration for candidates with special reasons such as illness or parental leave
  • Documents: Application letter; Curriculum vitae; Research plan; Teaching portfolio; Copies of relevant diplomas and certificates
  • Deadline: Not specified
  • Salary/Contract: Not specified

Doctoral students in integrated TN-NTN 6G and beyond networks (KTH)

  • Link: https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/861362?l=en
  • Responsibilities: Develop energy-efficient, resilient, and cost-effective 6G infrastructures.; Integrate terrestrial and non-terrestrial segments.; Support advanced digital services.; Research on distributed MIMO in space.; Explore antenna cooperation and beamforming in satellite constellations.; Address TN–NTN integration and network design.; Investigate management of cloud, processing, and radio resources.
  • Requirements: Passed a second cycle degree (master’s degree) or; Completed course requirements of at least 240 higher education credits, including at least 60 second-cycle higher education credits, or; Acquired equivalent knowledge in some other way.
  • Documents: Cover letter.; CV.; Transcripts of grades.; Research proposal.; Names of two references.
  • Deadline: Not specified
  • Salary/Contract: Monthly salary according to KTH’s Doctoral student salary agreement.

Postdoc in Sub Terahertz Band LEO Satellite Wireless Networks (KTH)

  • Link: https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/873414?l=en
  • Responsibilities: Coordinate research activities within the 6GSTAR project group; Lead collaboration in the international project; Publish in top-tier journals and conferences; Supervise MSc students and co-supervise PhD students
  • Requirements: A doctoral degree or an equivalent foreign degree; A doctoral degree (PhD) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Communications Engineering, or a closely related field; Strong research record in wireless communications, networking, or optimization; Publications in high-quality journals or conferences in the relevant subject areas
  • Documents: CV; Cover letter; Transcripts of degrees; List of publications
  • Deadline: Not specified
  • Salary/Contract: Not specified

Postdoc in modeling of transformation of sociotechnical systems (KTH)

Doctoral student in Machine Learning for Robotic Manipulation (KTH)

  • Link: https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/869586?l=en
  • Responsibilities: Develop novel approaches for large scale real-world robotic manipulation experiments and benchmarking; Incorporate robust and statistically reliable data-driven pipelines for robots to learn new manipulation skills; Establish large-scale real-world robotic manipulation datasets and benchmarks
  • Requirements: Passed a second cycle degree (e.g., master’s degree) or completed course requirements of at least 240 higher education credits including at least 60 second-cycle higher education credits; Mandatory requirement for English equivalent to English B/6; Goal-oriented and persevering work ethic, ability to work independently and collaboratively, and adeptness at analyzing complex issues
  • Documents: CV; Cover letter; Transcripts of records; Other relevant documents
  • Deadline: Not specified
  • Salary/Contract: Monthly salary according to KTH’s Doctoral student salary agreement

Assistant Professor in Condensed Matter Physics (KTH)

  • Link: https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/833402?l=en
  • Responsibilities: Conduct research at a high international level; Develop an independent research group; Collaborate with local condensed matter physicists; Supervise doctoral students; Research administration; Apply for funding; Contribute to the education of future scientists and engineers in physics; Teach in Swedish within four years
  • Requirements: Completed a doctorate or equivalent scientific competence; Qualified within seven years prior to the application deadline; Scientific expertise demonstrated through publications and conference attendance; Potential to qualify for a higher teaching position; Theoretical or experimental research background in quantum matter; Postdoctoral experience in a research environment other than the university of doctoral thesis defense
  • Documents: CV; Cover letter; Research plan; Teaching portfolio; List of publications
  • Deadline: Not specified
  • Salary/Contract: Not specified

Doctoral student in Electrochemical Sensing and Control for Organs-on-Chips (KTH)

  • Link: https://www.kth.se/lediga-jobb/867956?l=en
  • Responsibilities: Design and development of electrochemical sensors and electrochemical actuators; Testing and characterization of sensors and actuators; Collaboration with multidisciplinary team on Organ-on-Chip integration and biological application; Receiving support and guidance from supervisors; Learning crucial transferable skills in good research practice and communication
  • Requirements: Passed a second cycle degree (e.g., master’s degree) or completed course requirements of at least 240 higher education credits (including 60 second-cycle credits); Mandatory requirement for English equivalent to English B/6; Ability to independently pursue work, collaborate with others, have a professional approach, and analyze complex issues; Meritorious: Prior education in or experience with electrochemistry or catalytic surface engineering
  • Documents: Application form; CV; Transcripts of academic records; Letter of motivation; Any additional documents as specified by KTH
  • Deadline: Not specified
  • Salary/Contract: Monthly salary according to KTH’s Doctoral student salary agreement

item.title: DP_Question
item.description:
Preface

Because I always hit a wall with Dynamic Programming problems, I would like to summarize the solution to Dynamic Programming problems(DP).

Basic solution to DP problems：

  • Initial State
  • State Transition Equation

1. Linear DP

1. 1 Example：Leetcode 300. Longest Increasing Subsequence
Given an integer array nums, return the length of the longest strictly increasing subsequence.

Example 1:

Input: nums = [10, 9, 2, 5, 3, 7, 101, 18]
Output: 4
Explanation: The longest increasing subsequence is [2, 3, 7, 101], therefore the length is 4.

item.title: Markdown Study Notes
item.description:
Preface

This article mainly summarizes the common syntax of Markdown, so that you can write Markdown files better by yourself.

1. Basic Grammer

1.1 Title

Use# to create a title. The number of # you use indicates the number of heading levels.

Markdown Display
# title1

title1
# title2

title2
# title3

title3

1.2 Line break

Add 2 or more spaces after the text, or add a blank line (press enter twice).
